name: Definition of Probability
description:
Let $\Omega$ be a sample space. Suppose $\mathbb{P}$ is a real-valued function of all subsets of $\Omega$. That is to say, $\mathbb{P}:\mathcal{P}(\Omega)\mapsto\mathbb{R}$. $\mathbb{P}$ is a probability if it satisfies three axioms:
 1. $\mathbb{P}(A)\geq 0$ for any $A\subset\Omega$
 2. $\mathbb{P}(\Omega)=1$
 3. For any infinitely long sequence of events $A_1, A_2,\ldots,A_n,\ldots$ such that any two are mutually exclusive (e.g. $A_i\cap A_j=\emptyset$ if $i=j$), then the following holds: $$\mathbb{P}\left(\bigcup_{n=1}^\infty A_n\right)=\sum_{n=1}^\infty \mathbb{P}(A_n)$$
